data.title: July Inflation Became Obvious
data.meta_description: July Inflation Became Revealed - TÜİK announced the inflation data for July. CPI was announced as 61,78 percent annually and 3,23 percent monthly. Rental increase rates have also been determined along with the July CPI information, which is of great concern to homeowners and tenants.
data.text:
Consumer price index (CPI) increased by 61,78 percent annually and 3,23 percent monthly.

In July, it was 3,23 percent compared to the previous month, 28,76 percent compared to December of the previous year, 61,78 percent compared to the same month of the previous year and 65,93 percent compared to the twelve-month averages.

The main cluster with the least increase compared to the same month of the previous year was clothing and shoes with 39,57 percent, while the main cluster with the highest increase compared to the same month of the previous year was education with 104,50 percent.

In terms of main spending clusters, the main cluster that decreased in July 2024 compared to the previous month was clothing and shoes with -2,58 percent. On the other hand, the main cluster with the highest increase in July 2024 compared to the previous month was housing with 8,08 percent.

Of the 143 basic headings covered in the index (Classification of Individual Consumption by Purpose - COICOP 5-Level), as of July 2024, there was a decrease in the index of 24 basic headings, while the index of 4 basic headings remained unchanged. There was an increase in the index of 115 basic headings.

The change in CPI, excluding unprocessed food products, power, alcoholic beverages and tobacco and gold, was 2024 percent in July 2,47 compared to the previous month, 28,48 percent compared to December of the previous year, and 60,31 percent compared to the same month of the previous year. It was 68,37 percent compared to .XNUMX and twelve-month averages.

As you may remember, ENAG announced the July inflation as 100,88 percent annually and 5,99 percent monthly, an hour before TURKSTAT.
